intro: Cheiridopsis macrophylla, commonly known as the giant ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to harsh environments. Its low-growing habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
